channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2019 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Ousted Egyptian president Mohamed Morsy dies in court
item.description: Former Egyptian President Mohamed Morsy, the country's first democratically-elected leader, has died, Egyptian state media reported Monday.

item.title: The 78 wildest lines in Trump's epic ABC interview
Fashion icon and socialite Gloria Vanderbilt dies at 95
item.description: Gloria Vanderbilt died Monday morning, according to her son, CNN's Anderson Cooper. The fashion designer and socialite was 95.

item.title: Iran's latest blow to the nuclear deal
item.description: Iran will surpass the limit of low enriched uranium it is allowed to stockpile under the nuclear deal in 10 days, a spokesman for the Iranian atomic agency spokesman announced Monday, in the latest blow to the pact agreed with the United States and other world powers in 2015.

item.title: Three countries went dark and no one knows why
item.description: Argentina's energy secretary said he does not believe a cyberattack caused a massive power outage that left tens of millions of people in Argentina, Paraguay and Uruguay in darkness for several hours on Sunday.

item.title: Carrie Lam was supposed to unite Hong Kong. Instead she brought chaos
Eighth US tourist dies in Dominican Republic, resort says
item.description: Another US tourist has died in the Dominican Republic, bringing to eight the number of Americans to die in the country over the past year.

item.title: Future summers will 'smash' temperature records every year
item.description: If you think it's hot now, you haven't seen anything yet. A new study predicts that parts of the world will "smash" temperature records every year in the coming century due to climate change, "pushing ecosystems and communities beyond their ability to cope."

item.title: Family in police confrontation gets backing from Jay-Z group
item.description: A philanthropy affiliated with Jay-Z's Roc Nation, said it is offering support an Arizona family after a confrontation with police in Phoenix last month following an alleged shoplifting incident.

item.title: Airbus shows up Boeing on day one of the Paris Air Show
item.description: Airbus kicked off the Paris Air Show by unveiling a new jet and announcing orders for over 100 new planes. Its chastened rival Boeing was meanwhile stuck playing defense over the 737 Max.

item.title: Couple use Twitter to rescue newborn girl abandoned on garbage dump
item.description: Vinod Kapri, an Indian filmmaker based in New Delhi, checks Twitter first thing every morning -- like virtually every journalist on the planet.

item.title: A pro-migrant politician was shot dead. Officials suspect a far-right motive
item.description: A man arrested over the killing of a senior German politician earlier this month is believed to have links to the far right, prosecutors said Monday.

item.title: How one soccer club is helping educate fans on the horrors of the Holocaust
Huawei: US ban will cost us $30 billion
item.description: The founder and CEO of Chinese tech giant Huawei said the company will miss revenue forecasts by about $30 billion over the next couple of years and he blamed a US campaign against its business.

item.title: Beijing says US legalization of marijuana is a 'threat to China'
item.description: Beijing's leading drug enforcement body has blamed the legalization of marijuana in Canada and parts of the United States for a spike in the amount of drugs smuggled into the country, describing it as a "new threat to China."

item.title: Magician feared drowned after attempting Houdini-style trick
item.description: An Indian stuntman who went missing in the Hooghly River on Sunday after attempting a Houdini-style daredevil stunt is feared drowned, according to authorities.

item.title: 30 dead in triple suicide bomb blasts in Nigeria
item.description: Three suicide bombers, two girls and a boy, killed 30 people and injured 39 others when they detonated explosives in Nigeria's northeast, emergency response officials said on Monday.

item.title: China's Xi to make first official visit to North Korea
item.description: Chinese President Xi Jinping will arrive in North Korea on Thursday for a two-day state visit, his first official trip to the country since he came to power in 2012.

item.title: Scammers who posed as George Clooney arrested in Thailand
item.description: A couple dubbed the "Italian Bonnie and Clyde" who impersonated the US actor George Clooney to sell their clothing line have been arrested in Thailand.

item.title: Dad of missing backpacker makes tearful appeal
item.description: The father of an 18-year-old Belgian backpacker who has been missing in Australia for more than two weeks broke down in tears as he appealed for help to track down his son.

item.title: Parkland survivor calls out Harvard for rescinding admission over racial slurs he made 2 years ago
item.description: A Parkland shooting survivor and pro-Second Amendment activist said Harvard University rescinded his acceptance as a result of racist remarks he made before the 2018 massacre at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in Florida.

item.title: Israel announces new Golan Heights settlement named after Trump
item.description: Israel's Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has announced a new settlement in the Golan Heights named after his "great friend" Donald Trump.

item.title: World's 'longest range single-aisle airliner' unveiled
item.description: Aircraft manufacturer Airbus has unveiled designs for the A321XLR -- an aircraft it claims will be the world's "longest range single-aisle airliner."

item.title: A 'Hunger Games' prequel is on the way
item.description: A new entry in "The Hunger Games" series is on the way, though fans will likely have to navigate the violent world without Katniss Everdeen.

item.title: India is escalating a trade fight with America. It's a high risk strategy
item.description: India's decision to slap new tariffs on American goods over the weekend escalates a trade battle with the United States that may not be worth fighting and could backfire.

item.title: Accidental cat filter derails political press conference
Brazil lifts visa requirement for 4 countries
item.description: If watching a game at Rio de Janeiro's Maracanã stadium has been on your bucket list since the 2014 FIFA World Cup, you can now do so without adding a trip to the consulate as part of your itinerary.

item.title: 'Cat-sized' rats plague New Zealand town
item.description: A beachside New Zealand suburb known for roaming chickens and yoga has become infested with hordes of unwelcome guests: large, writhing rats.

item.title: Genius accuses Google of stealing song lyrics from its website
item.description: Music-annotation website Genius is accusing Google of stealing lyrics from its website and publishing them in search results.

item.title: Vatican will consider ordaining married men as priests in Amazon
item.description: The Vatican will consider allowing some married men in the Amazon region of South America to be ordained as priests, in order to help alleviate a shortage of Catholic clergy there.

item.title: 7 reasons to visit one of Southeast Asia's most beautiful towns
item.description: Set on the banks of the Thu Bon River in central Vietnam, Hoi An is easily one of the most beautiful towns in Southeast Asia.

item.title: Prince Harry picks up Diana's mantle on landmine removal
item.description: Prince Harry has urged governments around the world to finally clear Angola of landmines, continuing the work of his mother, Princess Diana, who famously walked through minefields in the war-torn country months before her death.

item.title: Your road trip guide to civil rights history in the South
The royals at Ascot
500 years of Indian treasures poised to break auction records
item.description: A collection of nearly 400 jewels, objects and gemstones from India is expected to fetch more than $144 million when it goes on sale this week -- a figure which would make it the most valuable jewelry auction in history.

item.title: The 'Paradise Island' that tourism forgot
item.description: Mozambique's coastline stretches about 2,470 kilometers along the warm waters of the Indian Ocean, and most of its beaches remain in pristine condition without hordes of tourists or tacky boardwalks.

item.title: Sotheby's sold to billionaire art collector for $3.7 billion
item.description: Telecom billionaire and art collector Patrick Drahi has emerged as the winning bidder for Sotheby's, the 275-year-old auction house.

item.title: The world's most harrowing drives
item.description: Ready for a road trip you'll never forget? Set your sights on one of these adventurous stretches of highway that provide access to some of the most arresting scenery on the planet.

item.title: What it takes to be an astronaut
item.description: During the 1966 Gemini 8 mission, commanded by astronaut Neil Armstrong, an error caused the spacecraft to spin so violently that his and astronaut David Scott's vision blurred.

item.title: NatGeo reveals best travel photo of 2019
item.description: A snowy fishing village in Greenland, a vulture soaring through the sky in Spain, and a trio of actors gearing up for an opera performance in China all make up the award winners in the 2019 National Geographic Travel Photographer of the Year awards.

item.title: Fast Facts: What you need to know about Mohamed Morsy
item.description: Here's a look at the life of former Egyptian President Mohamed Morsy, Egypt's first democratically elected leader.

item.title: Egyptian ex-President Morsy's life sentence overturned
item.description: An Egyptian court on Tuesday overturned a life sentence handed to ousted President Mohamed Morsy and 18 others for espionage, ordering a retrial in the case, Egyptian state media reported.

item.title: Egypt's bloody road from Arab Spring to chaos
item.description: For a moment in 2011, it appeared that the revolution worked. Thousands upon thousands of demonstrators who had massed in Cairo's Tahrir Square succeeded in toppling a dictator who had ruled for nearly 30 years.

item.title: Fact-checking Trump's ABC interview
item.description: In an extensive interview with ABC's George Stephanopoulos that aired Sunday evening. President Donald Trump made several factual blunders and repeated many of his favorite incorrect claims.

item.title: Carrie Lam was supposed to unite Hong Kong. Instead she brought chaos
item.description: Mass Hong Kong protests demand leader's resignation Hong Kong disrupts Beijing's plans for US, Taiwan

item.title: Germany cruises to knockout stages
item.description: Germany had already qualified for the knockout rounds of the Women's World Cup, but that didn't stop the high-flying side from dismantling South Africa in its final group stage match.

item.title: Taylor Swift and Katy Perry unite in video
item.description: Taylor Swift's "You Need To Calm Down" is a pop anthem for equality and understanding.

item.title: Why New Balance turned on Trump
US women set another World Cup record
